summary: US benchmark equity indexes advanced Thursday as a post-earnings rally in Microsoft rallied . Microsoft (MSFT) and Meta Meta (MMeta) were both big winners in the tech sector .

The 2025 Q1 earnings cycle is in full swing, with many companies on the docket to reveal quarterly results in the coming weeks . So far, several companies, including Boston Scientific BSX, Meta Platforms META, and Microsoft MSFT, have all delivered positive results .  Meta Platforms continued to fire on all cylinders throughout its latest period . Sales grew an impressive 16% year-over-year thanks to strong Advertising results, which totaled a solid $41.3 billion . The company’s average price per ad climbed 10% year over-year, with its family daily active people (DAP) also seeing a 6% move higher .  Microsoft Cloud and AI strength drove the strong results, with Microsoft Cloud revenue soaring 20% year-over-year to $42.4 billion . Sales of $70.0 billion and EPS of $3.46 both handily exceeded our consensus expectations . Demand has remained strong for the tech titan, with commentary alluding to the trend remaining for years .  Meta Platforms, Inc. META, and Microsoft MSFT – seeing a nice move higher following their respective quarterly releases . Boston Scientific Corporation (BSX) and Boston Scientific Corp. (BSx) also seeing a good move higher .

Tech stocks roared on Thursday, lifting the Nasdaq 1.2%, with the S&P 500 rising 0.6% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average up 83 points by market close . Amazon’s after-the-bell earnings release showed a handy beat of analyst estimates as the e-commerce giant posted earnings of $1.59 per share .  U.S. markets rose Thursday morning, lifted by blockbuster earnings from Microsoft and Meta . The Nasdaq was leading the charge, up 1.8%, with the S&P up 0.8% . Big Tech’s collective market cap near $10 trillion, investor sentiment looked ready to ride rally .  Microsoft stock was up 9% before the bell Thursday . Microsoft’s quarter drew gushing praise from analysts both on and off the earnings call . The company reaffirmed its $80 billion FY25 capital expenditures forecast .  Meta reported earnings of $6.43 on revenue of $42.3 billion, beating estimates on both the top and bottom lines . “While many companies have held back guidance amid tariff uncertainty, META did — a bullish sign,” Zacks strategist Andrew Rocco said .  Harley-Davidson pulled its full-year guidance altogether after international sales tumbled . Harley-Dogs pulled it out of guidance altogether, citing the growing weight of global trade uncertainty . The Russell 2000, a barometer of small-cap performance, is down 13.5% so far this year .  The U.S. closed down slightly on Tuesday night . The market is currently trading at $1.2 billion . The UVA closed down on Tuesday evening .

Reddit forecast second-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Thursday . Company's shares rose as much as 20% in extended trading, pared gains to trade up 7% . CEO Steve Huffman said on a post-earning call that the company expects some disruption from Google search .  Reddit's total number of active advertisers grew more than 50% in the first quarter, from a year ago . The company expects current-quarter revenue of $410 million to $430 million, above analysts' average estimate of $395.5 million .  Revenue grew 61% to $392.4 million in the first quarter, surpassing estimates of $370 million . Daily active unique visitors rose 31% to 108.1 million during the reported quarter . Reddit stock, which debuted in March 2024, fell 27% so far this year .

Applied Digital's share price was up 14.5% as of 3:30 p.m. ET . Microsoft and Meta Platforms published strong quarterly results yesterday . The tech giants are continuing to make big investments in AI processing . High levels of AI infrastructure spending are a positive demand indicator for Applied Digital .  Microsoft and Meta Platforms helped quell concerns among investors that growth for AI might be losing steam . Some recent reports suggested that Microsoft andAmazon canceled some data center leases and pulled back on infrastructure expansion plans . With its first-quarter report, Meta delivered a big increase for its full-year capex forecast .  Building out AI infrastructure is currently the biggest capex driver for Microsoft and Meta Platforms . The data center specialist posted sales of $52.9 million last quarter, falling well short of the average analyst estimate of $63.4 million . The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.5%, or 210 points . The S&P 500 gained nearly 1%, while the Nasdaq Composite advanced almost 2%, supported by strong results from Meta (NASDAQ:META) and Microsoft . META reported stronger-than-expected Q1 revenue and CEO Mark Zuckerberg said company remains well positioned .  Technology leading S&P sectors higher with a 3% gain . A rise in weekly jobless claims to 241,000 slightly dampened sentiment . The miss follows a weak GDP report earlier in the week showing a 0.3% annualized decline .

Shares of nuclear power providers Constellation Energy, Vistra Energy andOklo were in rally mode on Thursday, up 8%, 5.8%, and 8.5%, respectively . Microsoft and Meta Platforms reported strong earnings last night and either reiterated or grew their capital spending plans . As spending on AI grows, so will electricity demand .  The emergence of AI has been very bullish for utility stocks with existing nuclear capacity, such as Constellation and Vistra . Constellation has the largest amount of nuclear capacity of any U.S. utility . That includes Three Mile Island, which it will reopen by 2028 to serve Microsoft data centers .  Microsoft delivered a healthy revenue and earnings beat, with especially good performance from its Azure cloud platform . Management reiterated its capital expenditure (capex) plans for this fiscal year, while also noting that the company was still supply constrained by AI computing demand .  Platforms increased its capex plans for 2025, raising its guidance range from $60 billion to $65 billion . Given the rapid growth in AI infrastructure spending in 2023 and 2024, it's understandable that investors would be nervous about that strength continuing . The growth opportunities for whichever company leads in AI are too big to pass up .  The demand for electricity is still on a strong and accelerating growth path through the end of the decade . Data center investments should benefit these important power providers even if the economy slows down . Randi Zuckerberg, a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook and sister to Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors .

Shares of social network operator Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) jumped 7.2% in the pre-market session after the company reported strong first quarter 2025 results . Revenue grew 16% year over year, driven by a 10% rise in average ad prices and a 5% increase in impressions across Meta's Family of Apps .  Meta’s shares are not very volatile and have only had 7 moves greater than 5% over the last year . The company expects to continue investing in Reality Labs as its Ray-Ban Meta AI glasses are seeing strong traction . Overall, this quarter seemed fairly positive, and shareholders should feel optimistic .  Meta is trading 22.4% below its 52-week high of $736.67 from February 2025 . Investors who bought $1,000 worth of Meta’s shares 5 years ago would now be looking at an investment worth $2,825.

The company's stock gained 4.9% as of 2:11 p.m. ET and had gained as much as 5.2% earlier in the day . The leg up comes as theS&P 500gained 1% and theNasdaq Compositegained 2% on Thursday . Microsoft confirmed yesterday it's on track to spend $80 billion in artificial intelligence spending .  Supermicro had released preliminary numbers ahead of its earnings call on May 6 that spooked investors, leading to yesterday's 20% drop in the stock price . The company is mired in controversy surrounding its accounting practices and high-profile resignation of its auditor, Ernst & & Company .
